frame.name: FR_Commitment
frame.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Speaker</fen> makes a commitment to an <fen>Addressee</fen> about the veracity of some content or to carry out some action. The content or action to which the <fen>Speaker</fen> commits themselve take the form of a <fen>Message</fen>. <ex></ex>
<asf>Relation to fndata-1.5</asf> : new in fndata-asfalda
</def-root>

FE.name: Speaker
FE.definition: <def-root>The Speaker is the person who commits him/herself about the veracity. </def-root>

FE.name: Addressee
FE.definition: <def-root>The Speaker's commitment can be made to an Addressee. </def-root>

FE.name: Message
FE.definition: <def-root>An expression of the commitment made by the Speaker expresses the frame element Message. </def-root>

FE.name: Medium
FE.definition: <def-root>As with other frames in the Communication domain, the <t>Medium</t> of communication may be expressed. Medium is the physical entity or channel used to transmit the Message. </def-root>
